website_summaries.verdict: Offers quality and features for an unbeatable price. By far the best choice for budget-minded parents.
pros: An affordable double stroller made by one of the leaders in the baby space
Sports similar features as high-end double strollers, but it comes at a fraction of the price

website_summaries.verdict: Ideal for parents with twins or two infants, this tandem stroller boasts dual reclining seats, both of which are compatible with Graco Click Connect car seats.
pros: Both seats are fully reclinable, spacious, and comfortable
Rear seat is elevated, providing a clear view for backseat passengers and flattens to form a bassinet for nap time
Two seat trays, plus a parent tray keeps everyone's must-have items within easy reach
cons: Storage basket can be hard to access with the rear seat fully reclined

customer_reviews.title: It seems sturdy, comfortable for the kids
customer_reviews.text: I got it in Monday and have used it twice. It seems sturdy, comfortable for the kids, light and easy to push. We really like the style and the brand (was looking at baby trend similar style but we think Graco is a superiro brand and the price difference was only $15) there is a lot of space to put the diaper bag, my bag, sweaters, etc and has easy access to it. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patitobonito

customer_reviews.title: Stroller and two infants
customer_reviews.text: I got this stroller and the click connect 30xl. These are amazing to have for multiples! This stroller is very easy to push, the turn radius is phenomenal and I am just impressed all the way around with these products. If you're having twins,triplets or anything above, buy this stroller. I was extremely skeptical at first but now I couldn't be happier! When trying to put 2 carseat in, it's a little tricky to figure out at first but the small cup holder for the second seat closest to who ever is pushing, comes apart to fit the carseat on and that's how it clicks in. Just a heads up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cons -awning and trays pop off easily. -only one cup holder up front
customer_reviews.text: Cons -awning and trays pop off easily. -only one cup holder up front. - storage on bottom is hard to get too if both seats are occupied. - it takes up a LOT of space. - it doesn’t take basic car seats to lock in. Pros - lots of space for both passengers. - click lock storage container in top by cup holder. - pushes easily, not heavy. - folds and unfolds easily. - lots of under storage. Overall it’s a great bang for your buck. I think it’s a good stroller. Just wish I had another cup holder for outings such as the zoo or park. And easier access to storage.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to unfold and fold also is very flimsy to maneuver and car seat only fits in the front of the stroller and it sits very loose and not very secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sargon E. Daoud

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller. It fits everyone comfortably (21 months & newborn) and is easy for me to maneuver (I am 4'11, 105Lbs). Only downside is it won't fit in my '07 Jeep Grand Charokee so I have to use my husbands truck when I need to take it with me.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, easy to fold and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price we paid. It's really light weight and easy to fold. Love the large basket underneath...very convenient if you need to lug around a lot of stuff on your outing. The material is really cheap feeling. We actually had to send for a replacement, because the first one they sent us had a tear in the material on one of the canopies, and then underneath the front chair. The other con is that it's really long...so, if you don't have a big trunk, the stroller probably won't fit. We have a Yukon, so it fits just right, but literally butts up to each end. Other than that, it does what it needs to do, and it's affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large hunk of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Its bulky and heavy not easy to transport as you can barely get it to close.. You have to take half of it apart to close properly and good lucky rolling it to anywhere. Who ever designed this clearly doesnt have a kid let alone 2! It constantly pulls to one side so your fighting with it the whole walk! Take your money else where and buy something worth your money. I bought this while i was pregnant and wish i never did as now i cant return it.
customer_reviews.author: Cora

customer_reviews.title: Doubles are Doubles, but this one is great.
customer_reviews.text: Remember, all strollers, especially doubles, take some getting used to. So even though I struggled the first several times I used this stroller, I totally get it now and I love this stroller. The longer strollers make so much more sense to me than the wider strollers, even if it feels like I’m driving a limo. You can’t get away from that with any double stroller. I needed a stroller that I could clip in a car seat for a time being, and had two sweats with two trays, and I could get in and out of the trunk of my car. This stroller does that and I wouldn’t go with any other brand for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Nice investment
customer_reviews.text: Nice investment. I put it together in 10 minutes while also seeing how everything worked on it. I have it for my 2 year old and 6 month old. Super convenient to take walks with the kiddos during the day and with my husband when he’s back from work and the dog can join us on a family walk. It’s not very heavy, folds quickly to put aside, a lot of room in the carriage underneath...can’t find much of an issue with it! Glad we got it. I’ve had it for over month now and we love it. Walks almost every day with it and haven’t run into any issues.
customer_reviews.author: chey

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! My kids are 2 3/4 yrs apart. I didn’t buy the infant car seat this time. I just fit my infant inside the front seat using blankets and support pillows from other baby items. The cup holders are removable as well as the front hood. The basket in the bottom is nice and my 3yo keeps stepping inside of it with all his 41lb weight 🤦🏻‍♀️ and it still hasn’t ripped. Graco is generally pretty durable and is our preferred brand. We stroll through the neighborhood with this to get some vitamin D.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary & Jaclyn Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: This is okay. The cup holders are super shallow so anything in them pops right out if you go over a bump or are walking it on bricks or a dirt path. The backseat that reclines for infants doesn’t have a lot of leg room, and when it’s reclined back it’s absolutely impossible to get into the bottom net. Sometimes it clicks shut when I fold it and sometimes it doesn’t. Also the shades are very small and don’t keep the sun out. But the seats are padded well and easy to clean. But it is pretty light considering how big it is.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Decent value. But not perfectly designed.
customer_reviews.text: This is decent for the price. It’s fairly easy to use and I love that it works worth the Click Connect Graco system. Assembly was simple. It fits well on the back of my mini van. Here are my complaints: Just one adult cup holder and no cell phone holder. Back seat is slouched so toddler is sinking down. It doesn’t sit straight up. It can be difficult to get rear passenger out. Worst- the front wheels aren’t tight enough so they go crazy when going quick or if there’s leaves on the ground. Seems like the wheels are going to fall right off.
customer_reviews.author: Megan K

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality- plastic wheels worn after ONE walk. Returning.
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality. Was trying to not spend hundreds on a double but the plastic wheels are absolutely garbage and the stroller feels like it can tip over with any movement. I would say if you are looking for something to just push in the mall this will work... anything outside do not buy. Returning. Sucked it up and purchased a BoB double. It’s AWESOME.
customer_reviews.author: The Andre’s

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller works well for my 2 toddlers. It has a large cargo basket underneath. There are sunshades on each seat. I only with I could remove one seat, but it handles nicely and I don't feel it is too bulky to take out with one child in it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Tons of room, easy to fold, worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use this in a public setting BUT its amazing! This has more room than other double graco strollers and for half the price! Theres tons of options, and in all reality, it is worth more than a sit and stand because you really won't use a sit and stand as much as you think you will! Highly recommend this one instead of the other graco double stroller
customer_reviews.author: Kori and Adam LeMatty

customer_reviews.title: No shoulder straps, but great stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this stroller for my twins. It's so easy to use, fits in my 2011 escape trunk. It is easy to fold down. The ONE downside that I just noticed is that there are no shoulder straps. Only lap belts. The babies would totally be ready to transition to the regular seats (they are 6 months), but they still sometimes lean forward really far and could get hurt without the shoulder straps. Bummer!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great Double Stroller
customer_reviews.text: Needed a double stroller for my two boys who are 12.5 months apart (16 months and 4 months) and after reading several reviews on multiple strollers this one seemed the best. I love it, the price was great and it even pairs well with our Evenflo car seat. The only set back for me is it does not lock when folded up.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this stroller. I put it together by myself while I was 9 months pregnant, it was one of the easiest "baby gear" things I have ever put together. Honestly it was easier than putting a bouncer together lol. I have a 2 year old and a newborn and they both fit perfectly, the ride is smooth, and there's plenty of storage underneath for all our stuff. No problems at all so far. We use the Graco click connect 35, very simple to take in and out. I definitely recommend this stroller to anyone with two small babies!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Nice and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice lightweight stroller for 2 babies/toddlers. I have the graco car seat as well that’s pops right in. I like how easy it is to breakdown and how lightweight it is since I drive a truck and need to put it in the back, it doesn’t break my back to do so! Good price too comparing all other options on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Scheffel

customer_reviews.title: Made our life much easier!
customer_reviews.text: The good: We can actually fit our car seat on here, and our car seat is NOT the same brand, which is awesome. It fit perfectly in the back seat when it is in the laying position. Assembling was also very easy, pretty much just snap on the 4 wheels. And now for the one thing...This overall was a very good product, the only reason I docked one star off is because of rotability of the front two wheels. When using this in rougher grounds or grass, it was pretty hard to turn. Other than that I loved everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Happyrider

customer_reviews.title: Best double stroller double stroller I have owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest double stroller I have purchased. I have a home daycare and have gone through several strollers in 39 years. This was easy to assemble, maneuvers beautifully and provides comfortable seating for both children using it. I love the flap that positions at the foot end of the back seat when fully reclined... extra protection for infants even though they are belted in place!
customer_reviews.author: andrea saus

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Have had this stroller for 2 years. The bottom storage just started ripping. I’m going to try and see if I can fix it somehow. I would purchase again and definitely recommend this double stroller to others. Easy to push and fold. Fits nice in the back of a Toyota Corolla with room to spare. Wish the bottle/cup holder was a tad bit deeper.
customer_reviews.author: RKDLC

customer_reviews.title: Great Riding
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, comfortable, and safe tandem stroller. Canopies and trays give shade and panel for kid's busy hands, snacks and beverage bottle. Designed for easy assemble. All parts fit and snap lock. The seatbelt lock buckles are too small and too hard to press release. Child safe overplay turns into nuisance ergonomics. Back rests drop down for sleeping. Trays lift out to clean or stow, but the underside finger release is not marked, some thing that will break if forcing tray out. The rear wheel locks to park are toe kicked from front. Another oxymoron safety obsession.
customer_reviews.author: dcwest

customer_reviews.title: Good value; inspect before using.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a damaged sunshade (box showed no signs of damage) so we haven’t used it yet in case we need to return it for an exchange. Took about 30 minutes to assemble. Feels fairly lightweight and easy to handle/maneuver for a double stroller without air tires. Love that the back seat fully reclines flat and that there’s is a large storage basket. Also like the foot rests and the adjustable recline on the front seat, and the many cup holders. Not the plushest seats but comfortable enough and with material that looks easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: ELRA12

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is such an upgrade from the single stroller/carseat combo we got when we only had one baby. It is more durable and just feels like its better quality. I like that it has 2 brakes. The single brake on our single stroller broke (which graco wouldnt cover since it was 1year and 4 months old and not under 1 year) and i felt uneasy not having a brake to use. It took a few times to get the hang of how to fold this stroller, but you gotta learn to do a lot of things differently when youve got 2 babies instead of 1.
customer_reviews.author: Trecia

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller!!
customer_reviews.text: I was REALLY iffy about this stroller from seeing a lot of negative reviews.. but i also saw the same amount of good reviews..my 2.5 year old has a graco 4ever car seat so i decided to stick with the brand...needless to say this stroller fits in my Hyundai Santa Fe GREAT and i still have room, my toddler LOVES it and has PLENTY room and now we’re just waiting for baby #2 to be here in a couple weeks! I’m very impressed how easy it was to put together, open and close it, a push it! I love it!!! Not a single problem (so far) I’ll update if anything goes wrong but i truly don’t think it will!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby!
customer_reviews.text: The Graco DuoGlider stroller is pretty good for the price. My two kids fit in it well. My 3 month old sits in the back but he's still kind of small and needs to have extra support to keep him upright. The 2 year old loves the stroller. My one gripe is that I wish the sun visors covered the kids more. They don't seem to get full sun coverage especially when we go for afternoon walks. On the bright side, The storage underneath the stroller is great and fits a ton of stuff. Like I said before, for the price its a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great fit
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely harder to steer than my Graco single stroller but I guess that just comes with the territory of owning a double stroller? I was impressed with how compact it can be! We are having our 2nd child in a month so I haven't gotten to test it out with two kids but when I took a walk around the block, I had my toddler sit in the front seat and I hooked the infant car seat on the 2nd seat to see how it would feel. So far, I'm a big fan! I drive a Hyundai Elantra Touring so the trunk is a decent size but not huge. Stroller fits well with some room for other things
customer_reviews.author: Sydney/Steven

customer_reviews.title: Very bulky
customer_reviews.text: I wished it folded better than it does. Maybe there's something am missing, but it opens right up after folding it for storage. Overall we love it. It turns nicely and glides easily. The girls love it. Edit. 3.14.19 The weather's been fair these days so my girls and I go out for walks. Its lovely and glides smoothly. My only problem is with the foot rest. It needs to be extended for kids with long legs lol. My daughter's feet are almost on the ground and she's 3. I have to recline her to prevent her hitting her feet on the pavement. Everything else is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: e.adjabeng

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this stroller for the last few weeks. It’s so perfect! I have a newborn and a 20 month old. I love having the different options for riding. My favorite is having the Graco Click Connect car seat in the back and toddler in the front. It’s crazy easy to fold up and put in the back of your car. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wanted SO bad to love this stroller...dang it dang it dang it...
customer_reviews.text: Ugh, I wish it weren't true, but unfortunately this stroller wants to roll to the right. I strain my wrist trying to keep it straight on the sidewalk everytime. I ignored it for a bit because I really want to love this stroller. Also when you walk fast/ slow jog the wheels get rickety and wobble making the whole stroller bounce. I know it's not a jogging stroller, but I was trying to cross the street semi quickly and the stroller started freaking out. I'm just still so sad I can't love this stroller...darn.
customer_reviews.author: MichelleJ

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!!
customer_reviews.text: We saw someone at a doctors appointment with this stroller, and she told us it was perfect for her 3 month old and 3 year old. Having a 3 year old and newborn myself, it was really appealing to me to have a stroller for both kids. My mom was nice enough to buy us this stroller and compatible graco carseat as a baby gift, and I am beyond grateful! It's easy to maneuver, so convenient to just take the carseat out of the car and attach to the stroller, and my 3 year old loves to ride in it. Not to mention the storage basket underneath is super nice to have. I HIGHLY recommend this stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Seems great
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 months till our second little one is here and I’ll get to test it, but just from playing with it, it seems good quality for the price. I wasn’t able to find anything I like better cheaper. It will be great for my 2 year old and infant. The infant car seat fits nicely. My one complaint is the basket doesn’t drop down like most strollers so you can’t use the basket while using the bassinet or car seat in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price and quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice stroller! The best thing is that our Graco car seat fits to the stroller to the front or to the back. My older son sometimes want to sit to the back and we can easily adjust it and baby can go on the front seat in his car seat. For the price, this is really a good deal. I’m not sure if it would hold up with everyday use but for occasional use you wouldn’t need anything more expensive or fancier. We are happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chicagoan

customer_reviews.title: This is great for taller people
customer_reviews.text: This is great for taller people, and those with a long stride. I don't kick the axle at all, even at a decently fast pace. A few minor complaints: the rear canopy isn't vented and becomes a sail in the wind, really increasing the force needed to push the stroller. I can't figure out how to get it to latch folded up. The seats do not have adjustable recline, so your infant needs good body control to be able to sit in it. I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: watercat

customer_reviews.title: Not the Easiest to Maneuver
customer_reviews.text: My twins are eight months old, and we've beaten the crap out of this stroller. But it's holding up better than I expected. The quality is on par with what I expected, but folding this thing is a bit of a chore. And it isn't the most lightweight stroller out there. Trying to maneuver it through doors or into small rooms isn't easy, but I suppose it isn't as bad as a side-by-side. Overall, it was a good buy, and it does go over rougher surfaces easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Chichester

customer_reviews.title: Great option for two kids
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (out of the box) and easy. fold up/down for storage. Glides well and easy to attach car seat for use with baby and a toddler (would work well with 2 babies too). I like that it also has a " bassinet" feature in back seat if you don't want to use the carseat. Seems like it will fit well through doorways when out and about
customer_reviews.author: Devan

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. I love this stroller. I love that the back seat lays completely flat for a sleeping kiddo. Best part for me is that its compatible with my urbini infant carseat. Only downside is folding it up. Its kind of a pain and you have to really push it down on the ground to get it to click closed, and be gentle picking it up or else it wants to open back up on you.
customer_reviews.author: Pheona

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is THANK YOU GRACO! I love how you can put (Graco) car seats right in there and remove them without waking baby! They are also great because you don’t have to use a car seat, they can sit right in the stroller as in a normal stroller too! I have a one and two year old and mall trips have never been easier! Plenty of storage space underneath the stroller too! Has a cup holder and a place for keys or your phone and each kid has a tray with a cup holder! Love this stroller!
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was on vacation 3 hours away from my home when I realized I forgot my stroller at home. Found this stroller on Amazon and seen it offered one day shipping. I placed my order around 3pm and about 9 am the next morning the stroller and was delivered. Easy to put together even when you have a one year old helping. The only thing that irritated me was when you close the stroller you have to remember where the lock clip on the side is! I’ve wasted so much time trying to open the stroller because of that
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller for price! Easy to use! Recommend This!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the kids! I use the stroller at SeaWorld. If it both my little kids comfortably. It does take up a lot of room so make sure you look at the size, but it's really easy to use! Most rollers are too complicated especially double strollers. This one was easy to use and child-friendly! Make sure your baby sitting in the back isn't pulling your kids hair in the front! I recommend this stroller for families! Best buy for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great double for toddler and infant
customer_reviews.text: Love that there are so many different ways for my kids to sit and it’s easy to use. Folding is a little frustrating because you have to take off the trays in both seats - but that is just a convenience thing because removal is still very easy. I also wish there was a bit more leg room in the back seat - my toddler’s shoes always get stuck when I try to pull her out but the baby in the car seat is still up front.
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: Easy to maneuver but frustration with the details
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and down. I have it set up with the baby carrier in the back closest to me but because of the height of the area where the handle is, I can’t see the baby unless I get on the side or stand on my tiptoes. Also with the baby there, the sun shade covers up the cup holder unless I put it over him. For the toddler seat in the front, the cup holder section doesn’t easily unlatch on one side to flip over for him to get out. Have to lift him in and out over the cup holder/snack area. For such a big stroller it is easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Kim B.

customer_reviews.title: But still works pretty good. The back seat only goes up or ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper made than the other one I bought 10 years ago. But still works pretty good. The back seat only goes up or all the way back flat. No recline. Which is a bummer. And the wheels seem cheaper made. The front tray can now be left on when folded which is a nice touch. I would buy it again (well, actually, I did buy it again!) LOL
customer_reviews.author: Travelfamily

customer_reviews.title: Very long for standard vehicles
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this stroller so that I could get through standard size doors with my twins. Very easy to maneuver and easy to steer. Second row has less leg room but so far it hasn’t became a problem. I will say, its super long folded and difficult to fit in most standard vehicles... I own an Expedition Max so we have the room now but when we had an Explorer, I had to lay the 3rd row down just to put the stroller in the car. Another issue is the cup holder/umbrella is in the way of my sight and difficult to see my child on the second row.
customer_reviews.author: anormanlamb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality double stroller but isn’t exactly compact- takes up the entire trunk of my 4 door Ford Focus. It does work very well for a toddler and I enjoy that I can put the Greco infant car seat in the back which attaches perfectly.! Excellent price and much lighter in weight than similar stroller which go for $1,000 more dollars than this $180.00 one.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle G

customer_reviews.title: The best!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best double stroller on the market. The back seat even converts into like a bassinet for your infant. I love everything about mine. I had a similar double stroller 10 years ago and was glad to see Graco still had pretty much the same one available. Super easy to open and close, not terribly heavy, smooth driving, and good price. You can close this baby with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: K. LeeTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I researched double strollers for weeks before deciding on this one (based on description & reviews). I have only tested it out with my toddler (to be sure I like the push/stroll, open/close mechanisms...as our new baby hasn't arrived yet). It was easy to assemble, pushes very smoothly, has a great space for adult cup/few small items & big under carriage. The only thing I wish was a little easier was the closing mechanism - you kind of have to “slam” the stroller together to get the plastic latch to lock. Not a deal breaker but will be a little frustrating at times; I’m sure.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Maria Labatad

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. My Chico key fit car seat fits perfectly in the rear seat. My 4 year old fits great in the front. Negatives: the rear seat has two position 1. Straight up - not suitable for babies 2. All the way flat. My 3 month old likes to be reclined but not totally flat. There are not shoulder straps so babies are able to topple over when leaning forward. Does great on walks and places like the zoo. A bit difficult to push for "off roading" like at festivals with gravels paths, beach, grassy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Lorie Rutherford

customer_reviews.title: This is not good. Don't expect your toddler to fit on this
customer_reviews.text: This is not good. Don't expect your toddler to fit on this. My 2 year old is very skinny and he is so uncomfortable in this stroller. And one you put the car seat in it you won't be able to put anything on the bottom basket.
customer_reviews.author: daynelis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 small kiddos!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 week old and a 16 month old. The carrier fits perfect in the front or back (make sure you remove the cup holder), it folds up easily and stores in the upright position. With a little practice, I was able to open and close it with one hand. Plenty of storage. The only downside is the storage by the handle, there isn't enough room for a cellphone. So happy I got this!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought as new but it was used
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as "new" but once I opened it, it was very clear that this was used. Not heavy usage but used for sure, there were crumbs and some wax on it. It was basically already put together for me. That was n I ce. But still bought as new and irs used. Once the baby is here ill update the review to see if its still good.
customer_reviews.author: Starnes

customer_reviews.title: ... were a year a part and car seats are good for 5 years
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to buy a double stroller AND new infant car seat since my kids were a year a part and car seats are good for 5 years. So after looking and reading the details for each double stroller carefully this was the one for me! I love this one because it accepts any click connect car seat which is what we have. I recommend watching a YouTube video on how to put an infant car seat on the stroller if you have an infant and a toddler. This was the cheapest and accommodating double stroller which is why I bought it
customer_reviews.author: Joyce D

customer_reviews.title: So happy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to maneuver, folds down to basically the same size as our single rider Graco modes. It’s not too heavy, easy to fold, both the kids are comfortable. It’s true you can’t access the basket when the baby car seat is clicked in in back. Buy a hook for $7 until your kid gets out of the infant car seat. Or put baby in the front. For $125, I will deal with these minor issues. I’m sure they will fix this issue w a future model, like just make the basket material stretchy so you can get in a little easier. All in all, wonderful. Don’t spend more.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W.

customer_reviews.title: Some shortcomings but overall happy
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight. Fits in my small Camry trunk. Easier to get up and over curbs than me single stroller. Front seat is a little tight for older children. Wish the bassinet style for babies could face backwards - there is a viewing window but hard to see the child’s face is they are taller and farther back. My average height (6 foot) husband has a hard time pushing it because the handle is so short and he kicks the storage basket when he walks.
customer_reviews.author: EM

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed by this stroller. High quality and sturdy. It takes space but it's perfect for two kids. Totally worth spending the money on this.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Best double stroller
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is fantastic! So easy to move and get around in! It is so versatile! I have a two year old son and 7 week twins. I sometimes will put both twins in there or put my 2 year old and baby in and wear the other. My 2 year old always thinks it’s a treat to get in! I was scared it would be hard to see both babies but have not had an issue! It folds up compact and is worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great double stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller. Great to use, love the storage, love the design and the drink trays. I don't like the adult drink holder and little tray. It is so tiny that nothing significant really fits in it. Definitely not all drinks. other than that, which can be supplemented with a hanging organizer its great. Except only on concrete/cement/carpet/tile/vinyl etc. Definitely not good offroading or on trails. Definitely need a jogging stroller for that.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Reputable Brand + Great Product = Happy Mom and customer
customer_reviews.text: Really well made stroller. Stroller is very durable and strolls very smoothly. I bought this stroller for my 2 and 5 year old, (bigger kids for going to Disney World) and the stroller holds up very well. I've had no problems with the maneuvering. I really like how the back seat reclines to a sleep position and the cup holder and bar are removable. The versatility really came in handy. :) The stroller is surprisingly not as bulky as I had anticipated which is another plus. I would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great stroller, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I assembled this stroller by myself while I was pregnant so it wasn’t very hard, it’s lightweight and easy to handle, I love it! I have an 18 month old and a 4 month old now and it works perfect for both of their needs, the 18 month old can even lay back and take a nap in the top seat, it’s a life saver in small stores and places that I can’t have my toddler running around. Very sturdy and nicely made.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stroller! Way easier to maneuver than the Chicco Bravofor2 . The reason we bought this stroller because we wanted something that turns easy and this is it! Also easy for loading and unloading. Back seat fully reclines. Even my 5 year old can sit in the front and back. He's about 42 lbs and my daughter is 31 lbs and they both together were easy to push compared to my newborn and toddler in the old stroller. I'm very pleased so far. I've used it about 6 times
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Braucksick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. There is coloring all over the top cup holder area, holes in the storage net, the wheel area is damaged from what looks like a hammer being used on it. And it doesn’t lock to stay folded. I did buy in “Very good” condition which is supposed to only mean that the packaging is damaged not the product itself.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great! But missing parts..
customer_reviews.text: I love the stroller and it’s really easy to fold down. The basket is super roomy and I love the cup holders! ONLY negative about it, is it doesn’t come with the arm bar for the infant car seat so you will need to purchase that separately. Not a big deal because you can buy from graco for 12.50 but I wish I would of know a head of time when I bought the stroller.
customer_reviews.author: Sophia Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Good stroller
customer_reviews.text: Great stroller so far (only had couple weeks) my 18month old rides in the front and 8 week only rides in carrier in the back. Instructions to get this thing together we're not good. I had to figure a lot out to get the thing to snap close to put in my car and trying to figure out how to get the car seat carrier snaps in the back seat was very difficult still not sure if I have correct. Kinda hard to get stuff in and out of lower basket when kids are in it. When the kids are in it the are happy and helps keep everything rangled.
customer_reviews.author: K.Max

customer_reviews.title: Family comes to visit
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase for ease of transporting grandchildren coming by plane for a visit. It was a great deal of help. My grandson is 2 1/2 and my granddaughter is 10 months. It could hold my granddaughter in her car seat and also my grandson was comfortable too. It was also great when my granddaughter was not in a car seat. It was worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Not for daily use, great for long trip
customer_reviews.text: Positive: very roomy to carry extras at the bottom, both kids can nap. Negative: if you’re a single mom, or your car is small, don’t even think of buying this one. It’s very bulky and hard to load Onto car. You’ll also have a hard time navigating the stroller as the wheels are not responsive. Bottom line, I’d use this only if I have to go on a long trip where I need to load stuffs and the kids need nap time. For daily use, it’s a no no
customer_reviews.author: QUYNH-TRAM

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This stroller is very convenient now knowing I’m going to be a mom of two! I have a two year old who fits perfectly and comfortably and has no issue with this stroller as other ones he doesn’t like & my car seat for my newborn clicks in perfectly! It was easy to assemble and it moves with no problem. For the price, you can’t beat this!
customer_reviews.author: Destiny Jackson

customer_reviews.title: love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: love this stroller! It is a large stroller but what do you expect when you are trying to cart two kiddos around. It has a lot of storage too! I also love the way it easily collapse and is not too heavy to lift into your trunk.
customer_reviews.author: Marlise

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I love that the back seat lays all the way down like a bassinet, but unfortunately it requires both hands to pull the two sides out to let it down. Not convenient when holding the baby. The back seat also only lays flat or goes all the way upright. I wish it had one or two in between.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stroller. I have a 13 month old and a newborn. They fit perfectly in it and still enough room for their diaper bags. I love that the kiddos can grow into it too. It’s easy to maneuver and not as big as I thought it’d be. Definitely worth every penny to me!
customer_reviews.author: Nicolette S

customer_reviews.title: Boomer Grandma
customer_reviews.text: It was mostly assembled when I received it in the box. Yeah! I had to "pop" the body of it apart to open it and then it was easy to finish assembling. First use and why it is not rated as a 5 is because unless it is on very flat surface, it pulls to downhill side. With its length, it is quite a pull for this 68 year old in very good health grandma.
customer_reviews.author: AntesV

customer_reviews.title: I love this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller! Perfect for twins! Makes doctors appointments and outings so much easier to just click the car seats in and my two year old can sit in the stroller while the babies are being assessed. Folds up nicely, about the size of a single stroller. Good steering and storage. We haven’t upgraded vehicles yet so we store it in the passenger seat of our Mazda 5 mini-mini van and it fits nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke soderlund

customer_reviews.title: Made our lives easier!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this is a really good stroller and we're glad to get this kind instead of the side-by-side seat. This stroller looks complicated but unbelievably easy to use. 1 step to unlock and 2 steps to fold it back. Both seats are reclinable and has a very spacious storage underneath.
customer_reviews.author: lg

customer_reviews.title: I really like this stroller
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stroller. The ride is smooth for my son and he was able to sit in it at 4 months with a little extra support from blankets. I like that the back seat fully reclines. We use it for walks with his cousin who is one month older. The basket in the bottom is huge. I did not like that it did not fit into the trunk of my elantra. I think we could if we took off the canopies but that seems like a hassle for everyday use. It does fit into the trunk of our corolla.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and looks great
customer_reviews.text: I have two boys that are both in strollers instead of using two we found this stroller. It is lightweight and easy to push. Lots of room for both boys and I can lay it flat when our 6 month old is sleeping. We travel a lot with them it is easy to fold up and pack.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can't get to bottom carriage when first seat is reclined.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2.5 year old and newborn. It does what it needs to do, but it is quite bulky. My biggest frustration is that if I have the car seat on or the baby reclining in the back seat, you can't get to the under carriage. Also, the window to see the baby laying down is in an awkward position.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Cline

customer_reviews.title: 4.5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: If I could give 4.5 stars I would. My ONLY complaint is sometimes it doesn't lock when I fold it and I have to reopen/close it a few times. Other than that, very convenient and smooth cruising. It's an awesome feature that the backseat lays completely flat for naps, and the front seat reclines a good amount too. Great storage space too!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Woods

customer_reviews.title: Good considering cheap price
customer_reviews.text: Good stroller for the price. Pros: easy glide and steering; folds small enough and light enough that I can put in back of RAV4 Cons: back seat only has 2 options to recline- upright or totally flat; no shoulder straps on either seat; not enough leg room in back seat or support for legs to dangle in front seat for toddler
customer_reviews.author: sinkingputts

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my toddler and my new baby. It works great so far! I put the baby in the car seat in the front seat and have my toddler in the back. This way we both see the baby . I have a Grace click connect and it works fine (just don’t forget to remove the tray or it won’t snap into place) it’s a little heavy but to be expected. I haven’t used it for travel yet but I expect it should do alright
customer_reviews.author: E Amr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this stroller ! Once figuring out how to put the car seat in it for the first time, it's been a breeze ever since! Easy to push Round and firs my kids happily. Only thing I would change is for the back seat, making it adjustable to more than just straight up or flat down.
customer_reviews.author: kbaby

customer_reviews.title: Good for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Slightly flimsy frame design but its lightweight, so that's the tradeoff. Due to solid handle design its easy to steer with one hand. Very important. Fits in our trailblazer fine when folded. The cup and snack holders are extra nice features for the kids.
customer_reviews.author: airtight_python

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT fit a Tesla Model X (6-Seater Config) easily.  Fits Mercedes GLS fine.
customer_reviews.text: For those Tesla Model X owners, this will NOT fit a Tesla Model X (6-Seater Config) easily. For max efficiency and capacity, you will need to take off the accessory, rest one of the 3rd row seats down, fold the stroller and lay it FORWARD with the wheels near the hatch, otherwise, it WILL NOT fit properly. Mercedes GLS, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zemma

customer_reviews.title: No 5 pt restraint think twice
customer_reviews.text: This stroller does not have a 5 point restraint. This is a large problem. My grandson is a toddler and its dangerous for him to be without that restraint. My husband will install one. This is very disappointing you would think that a company like Graco would have the safety of children in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Elsibay

customer_reviews.title: Love this stroller!!
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far!!! The bottom holds alot and I've had no problems with the wheels as others have said. It's not big and bulky like others I've used before. Only con I have so far is that back seat. It either sits up or lays all the way down, no in between. Still an awesome stroller!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is GREAT. You can’t really access the basket or parent console/cup holder with a car seat snapped in the back. It could use a little shock absorption. The back has very little legroom. However, it’s got good shade canopies and folds up reasonably compact.
customer_reviews.author: austenfan442

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great Stroller for the price. I think it came as amongst the lightest in our research of double strollers without compromising on features like space between seats, Canopy, front & back trays & a huge shopping basket! & yes we did crazy level of research before finalizing on this one to suit our budget! The huge basket fills all our needs for traveling on short & long trips bcoz we love to carry lot of stuff with us :)
customer_reviews.author: Soniyan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stroller for us!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this stroller. Perfect for our newborn and 2.5 year old. Baby carseat can sit in the back, up higher facing us, allowing our toddler to sit in the front. All you have to do is remove the attachment on the cup holder for it to for nicely. OR the carseat can sit lower up front facing us allowing our toddler to look in at the baby and play. I also love that the back seat can recline to flat and a foot panel comes up so my toddler can completely lay down. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Kaylah S.

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I’m very satisfied with this product..easy to fold/open and it’s light as like our single stroller. Perfect to bring with 2 kids when traveling. Overall I’m happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eme G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for my two kids!
customer_reviews.text: Loved that i got this product for $88 (I got an option as the pack was opened/ damaged). I ordered it because we dint want to invest in another child gear again. We wanted a double stroller from a long time and was waiting for buying something worthy. When i found this for $88- i ordered it immediately. :) Product looks good. No damages nothing. Easy to install. Only concern is that my older one who is 5yo is pretty tall. She finds it hard to get in and get out of the stroller with the cup holder. Other than that- we liked the product.
customer_reviews.author: Swetha

customer_reviews.title: Great for disney!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stroller for my three year old and new baby. I put my baby in the back since the back seat can lay totally flat. My three year old sits in the front. We removed the front cup holders to make it more convenient. My three year old just hops in on the front when she gets tired of walking. Lots of storage underneath too. I prefer strollers that are narrow vs. wide so you can navigate through crowds better. Wheels work great too! Fits just right in the back of my Buick encore too!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers and new borns babies
customer_reviews.text: I love being a head of the time. We bought this beauty weeks ago and it works just perfect. It doesn’t take a lot of space in our trunk. Our second baby still cooking in the belly but we have been using the other seat as storage and fits a lot. Imagine a little baby.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Antonio Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Just What They Wanted!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this as a gift for my nephew and his wife who just had twins. They were thrilled to receive it!
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Great Stroller, but you can't get parts....
customer_reviews.text: Love the stroller, but my SIL accidently ran over one of wheels on the first one we bought, nothing wrong with the stroller, but we could not find a wheel that could replace it and Graco said it was discontinued, so we had to throw the whole stroller away and buy a new one.... waste of money, but it's a nice stroller for the price and its easy to manage when you have 2 babies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s an ok double stroller
customer_reviews.text: I like that it fits easily in my trunk. It maneuvers pretty easy as well. Using the infant seat on the back is a pain! Getting the baby in and out of the car seat while on the stroller is not easy! Getting anything of the storage basket while the rear seat is reclined is nearly impossible w/o disturbing the baby laying down. Would I purchase this stroller again? NO! Did I get what I paid for? Yep!
customer_reviews.author: Becky E

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret buying this stroller! I LOVE it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy any other double stroller! This one is PERFECT! It's not too bulky, BOTH seats recline, looooots of storage room, my 3 and 1 year old sit in it so comfortably, I am very happy and so relieved that I finally found the perfect double stroller, I Highly recommend you buy one too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Heavy!
customer_reviews.text: 1st there’s nothing light about this, it’s extremely heavy you will get back pain. 2nd the folding is easy but the the lock does not stay in place. 3rd the seats are Small Claustrophobic the child doesn’t have enough space. 4th The only positive thing is it connects the graco click connect car seats. You should avoid this stroller at all cost. Invest in something better. I can’t believe these people made this heavy crap.
customer_reviews.author: rezaul rabby

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this stroller. First of all the back chair doesn’t even have a seat. There is literally a flimsy ass piece of plastic(maybe) as the seat and as you can see from the pic the kid will slouch down and be uncomfortable bc the back of the seat goes right into the part they sit on. It’s like a slope. The only thing holding them in I’d the strap. It’s huge also. I just wouldn’t recommend bc of the back seat. No way it’s comfortable in the least.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love it so far!
customer_reviews.text: Traded in my single for a double. Everything snapped together so easily and was pretty simple to adjust. Not much bigger or heavier than my single stroller when folded up and stands up wonderfully for storage. My Graco car seat snaps in perfectly. Big storage basket. I really love this a stroller so far! Will update on durability.
customer_reviews.author: wheredidmyhammergo

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: great buy - did a lot of research before deciding on style for 2 infants - won't know till March on how well it works - all I can say is top rated and for the money and ease of getting home is well worth it - got the matching car seat. Love Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jacksmom

customer_reviews.title: Graco Duo Glider Click Connect Stroller...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my niece when she added a new baby to the existing toddler... She love it & uses it all the time... The 3 year old doesn't mind getting a ride & is easier to keep her safe than wandering along... The baby is still using a infant seat that attaches to the stroller with ease... This will get many years of use, especially on all day outings where too much walking wears out the the older child...
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Aldrich

product_meta.title: Graco DuoGlider Double Stroller | Lightweight Double Stroller with Tandem Seating, Glacier
product_meta.description: Comfy adventures for two, plus you. The Duo Glider Click Connect Double Stroller has all the essentials a growing family needs. This lightweight double stroller features stadium-style seating, so the child sitting in the rear is slightly raised for a better view. To keep both passengers nice and comfy, both seats feature a reclining seat, child's tray, rotating canopy and footrest. And for Mom, a one-hand fold, extra large storage basket, and parent's tray. The Duo Glider tandem stroller accepts two Graco infant car seats, too. Care and Maintenance: Wash removable seat cushion in cold water on delicate cycle and line dry. To clean stroller frame, use only household soap and warm water. Never use bleach. If wheels squeak, use a light oil. Each seat holds child up to 40 lbs
feature_bullets: Accepts two Graco Snug Ride Click Connect infant car seats; tandem stroller Holds 2 children up to 40 pounds each
One hand, standing fold closes easily with no bending necessary, leaving one hand Free for baby; Easy access, drop down storage basket lets you reach in without disturbing Your reclined child
Double stroller features 2 reclining seats with individual canopies and footrests; rear seat reclines Completely flat when baby's had enough adventure
Lockable front swivel wheels with suspension for superior maneuverability; parents tray with storage and 2 cup deep Holders for on the go convenience
Stroller weight: 29.5 pounds; Stroller length: 36 inches; Stroller width: 20.5 inches; Stroller height: 41 inches; Folded height: 29.5 inches; Folded width: 20.5 inches
Extra Large storage basket provides room for all Your essentials

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,084 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
